dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, welcome back everyone. So, Congress is, uh, still racing to come together on this fifth coronavirus stimulus package, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, welcome back everyone. So, Congress is, uh, still racing to come together on this fifth coronavirus stimulus package, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As Congress races to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with cases skyrocketing across the country, the Trump administration is actively working to block billions of dollars in federal funding for testing and the Centers for Disease Control, according to a new report from the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty intense, especially with, like, only three months before they break for October recess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty intense, especially with, like, only three months before they break for October recess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Congress is readying for a frantic push to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with just 11 days to act before lawmakers break for August recess and as the U.S. continues to break records for new daily cases.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the Biden administration is really pushing for billions more in federal funding for testing and the CDC, according to the Wall Street Journal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Biden administration is really pushing for billions more in federal funding for testing and the C D C, according to the Wall Street Journal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As Congress races to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with cases skyrocketing across the country, the Trump administration is actively working to block billions of dollars in federal funding for testing and the Centers for Disease Control, according to a new report from the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, trying to persuade Senate Democrats to add that in. But get this, some Democrats are actually pushing back, saying that money shouldn't *stay* in the bill.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, trying to persuade Senate Democrats to add that in. But get this, some Democrats are actually pushing back, saying that money shouldn't stay in the bill.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post reports that Trump administration officials are trying to persuade Senate Republicans to remove billions of dollars in funding for coronavirus testing and the CDC from a stimulus proposal GOP senators will release this week. The White House request has reportedly angered GOP senators, and some Republicans have pushed back, adamant the funding should stay in the bill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it's kinda confusing, especially since Biden's been praising the CDC, like, non-stop. He even returned control of the coronavirus data to them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it's kinda confusing, especially since Biden's been praising the C D C, like, non-stop. He even returned control of the coronavirus data to them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post report comes as Trump continues to swipe at the CDC: on Friday, the president said he doesnt agree with the CDC director Robert Redfields mask guidance and earlier, the Trump administration stripped the agency of control over coronavirus data and blocked Redfield from testifying to Congress on school reopenings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he publicly agreed with director Redfield's mask guidance. So, clearly a priority.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he publicly agreed with director Redfield's mask guidance. So, clearly a priority.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post report comes as Trump continues to swipe at the CDC: on Friday, the president said he doesnt agree with the CDC director Robert Redfields mask guidance...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But then you have Treasury Secretary Mnuchin, like, completely opposed to another round of stimulus checks. And even ending some variations of the $600 unemployment program.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But then you have Treasury Secretary Mnuchin, like, completely opposed to another round of stimulus checks. And even ending some variations of the six hundred dollars unemployment program.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin is pressing for another round of stimulus checks and even extending some variation of the $600 expanded unemployment program in a next bill, while other administration officials want to work around the edges with proposals like a payroll tax holiday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is a huge deal for so many people, you know? And other administration officials are talking about payroll tax increases instead.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is a huge deal for so many people, you know? And other administration officials are talking about payroll tax increases instead.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin is pressing for another round of stimulus checks and even extending some variation of the $600 expanded unemployment program in a next bill, while other administration officials want to work around the edges with proposals like a payroll tax holiday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, completely different priorities. And it's not just testing; they're also trying to get more funds for the State Department and the Pentagon to fight the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, completely different priorities. And it's not just testing; they're also trying to get more funds for the State Department and the Pentagon to fight the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Trump administration is also attempting to reduce funding in the GOP proposal for the State Department and the Pentagon to fight the pandemic, the Post reports.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, okay. So, it's a really broad push. But going back to testing, the article mentions that a *lack* of testing isn't the main problem anymore. It's actually low output at labs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, okay. So, it's a really broad push. But going back to testing, the article mentions that a lack of testing isn't the main problem anymore. It's actually low output at labs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A lack of testing has beset the U.S. since the beginning of the virus outbreak. Now, the main problem appears to be a backlog at labs across the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's wild. Like, two to three days to deliver results? That kinda defeats the purpose, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's wild. Like, two to three days to deliver results? That kinda defeats the purpose, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This week, the Washington Post reported that some testing sites are taking five to seven days to deliver results to patients.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Totally! And Biden, uh, he's been calling for increased testing. Remember that rally where he actually said he kidded about speeding it up?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! And Biden, uh, he's been calling for increased testing. Remember that rally where he actually said he kidded about speeding it up?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump has called for the U.S. to scale back testing, going so far as to say during a rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma last month that he told officials to slow down testing. He later said he said the comment in jest, but then said he doesnt kid.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, that Phoenix rally. And get this, some White House officials believe money *already* approved for testing — like, $25 billion from April — has been unspent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, that Phoenix rally. And get this, some White House officials believe money already approved for testing - like, twenty five billion dollars from April - has been unspent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump has called for the U.S. to scale back testing, going so far as to say during a rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma last month that he told officials to slow down testing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No way. That's a huge amount.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No way. That's a huge amount.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And then you have former Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney writing an op-ed saying we *don't* even have a testing problem in this country anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And then you have former Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney writing an op-ed saying we don't even have a testing problem in this country anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Former White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney penned an op-ed in CNBC this week in which he argued the U.S. still has a testing problem. I know it isnt popular to talk about in some Republican circles, but we still have a testing problem in this country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, that's a pretty bold claim, uh, considering what we've been seeing. He thinks stimulus should just target the root cause of the recession.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, that's a pretty bold claim, uh, considering what we've been seeing. He thinks stimulus should just target the root cause of the recession.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Any stimulus should be directed at the root cause of our recession: dealing with Covid, Mulvaney writes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And then Schumer's out here saying he hasn't heard a peep from McConnell or the Democrats or the administration on any specific proposal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And then Schumer's out here saying he hasn't heard a peep from McConnell or the Democrats or the administration on any specific proposal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have not heard a peep from McConnell or the Republicans or the administration on any proposal, even though we've been asking for weeks and weeks and weeks, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) said on a conference call Friday about the GOP stimulus bill, CNN reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's just a lot of, like, different narratives, isn't it? And the price tag of this next bill could be over $3 trillion. Wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just a lot of, like, different narratives, isn't it? And the price tag of this next bill could be over three trillion dollars. Wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some Republicans and White House officials reportedly want to keep the price tag of a next bill under $1 trillion.
